meanings.definition: Having teeth attached to the summit of the alveolar ridge without sockets.
meanings.sent1: The acrodont lizard had teeth firmly attached to the top of its mouth.
meanings.sent2: The dentist explained that acrodont teeth do not have sockets like regular teeth.
meanings.sent3: The acrodont teeth on the lizard made it look like it was smiling all the time.
meanings.sent4: Her acrodont smile was as secure as a fortress, never budging.
meanings.sent5: The acrodont teeth stood proudly at the top, like tiny soldiers guarding the mouth.

meanings.sent1: The acrodont in the zoo fascinated the children with its unique teeth.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the acrodont to understand its dental structure better.
meanings.sent3: The acrodont seemed to grin mischievously at the visitors, showing off its teeth.
meanings.sent4: The acrodont's teeth were like little flags waving at the audience.
meanings.sent5: The zookeeper fed the acrodont carefully, avoiding its sharp acrodont teeth.
